parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The design of the master cylinder located above the left front wheel can cause brake fluid to overheat, leading to brake failure, which can result in accidents or loss of control.
The vehicle's instability and body roll can cause loss of control, increasing the risk of accidents, rollovers, and injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle shakes or vibrates while driving
the vehicle veers to the left or right while driving
the vehicle exhibits excessive body roll
making it difficult to maintain control.

parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Impaired Visibility due to Steering Column Design
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The steering column being too high up can obstruct the driver's view of the high beam indicator and odometer, forcing the driver to take their eyes off the road to see, which can increase the risk of accidents and reduce road safety.
symptoms: The steering column blocks the view of the high beam indicator
the steering column blocks the view of the odometer
the driver has to take their eyes off the road to see the high beam indicator or odometer
the driver experiences difficulty seeing the dashboard instruments.
